APPLET_SHELLCODE_FORMAT.description: Format shellcode before it's placed on the HTML page generated to serve the Signed or Smart Applet Attacks.

EXECUTABLE_ARTIFACT_GENERATOR.description: Control the EXE and DLL generation for Cobalt Strike

HTMLAPP_EXE.description: Controls the content of the HTML Application User-driven (EXE Output) generated by Cobalt Strike

HTMLAPP_POWERSHELL.description: Controls the content of the HTML Application User-driven (PowerShell Output) generated by Cobalt Strike

POWERSHELL_COMMAND.description: Change the form of the powershell comamnd run by Cobalt Strike's automation. This affects jump psexec_psh, powershell, and [host] -> Access -> One-liner.

POWERSHELL_COMPRESS.description: A hook used by the resource kit to compress a PowerShell script. The default uses gzip and returns a deflator script.

POWERSHELL_DOWNLOAD_CRADLE.description: Change the form of the PowerShell download cradle used in Cobalt Strike's post-ex automation. This includes jump winrm|winrm64, [host] -> Access -> One Liner, and powershell-import.

PSEXEC_SERVICE.description: Set the service name used by jump psexec|psexec64|psexec_psh and psexec.

PYTHON_COMPRESS.description: Compress a Python script generated by Cobalt Strike.

RESOURCE_GENERATOR.description: Control the format of the VBS template used in Cobalt Strike.

RESOURCE_GENERATOR_VBS.description: Controls the content of the HTML Application User-driven (EXE Output) generated by Cobalt Strike.

SIGNED_APPLET_MAINCLASS.description: Specify the MAIN class of the Java Signed Applet Attack.

SIGNED_APPLET_RESOURCE.description: Specify a Java Applet file to use for the Java Signed Applet Attack.

SMART_APPLET_MAINCLASS.description: Specify the MAIN class of the Java Smart Applet Attack.

SMART_APPLET_RESOURCE.description: Specify a Java Applet file to use for the Java Smart Applet Attack

-is64.description: Check if a session is on an x64 system or not (Beacon only).

-isactive.description: Check if a session is active or not. A session is considered active if (a) it has not acknowledged an exit message AND (b) it is not disconnected from a parent Beacon.

-isadmin.description: Check if a session has admin rights

-isbeacon.description: Check if a session is a Beacon or not.

-isssh.description: Check if a session is an SSH session or not.

action.description: Post a public action message to the event log. This is similar to the /me command.

addTab.description: Create a tab to display a GUI object

addVisualization.description: Register a visualization with Cobalt Strike

add_to_clipboard.description: Add text to the clipboard, notify the user

alias.description: Creates an alias command in the Beacon console

alias_clear.description: Removes an alias command (and restores default functionality if it existed)

applications.description: Returns a list of application information in Cobalt Strike's data model. These applications are results from the System Profiler

archives.description: Returns a massive list of archived information about your activity from Cobalt Strike's data model. This information is leaned on heavily to reconstruct your activity timeline in Cobalt Strike's reports.

artifact_general.description: Generates a payload artifact from arbitrary shellcode

artifact_payload.description: Generates a stageless payload artifact (exe, dll) from a Cobalt Strike listener name

artifact_sign.description: Sign an EXE or DLL file

artifact_stager.description: Generates a stager artifact (exe, dll) from a Cobalt Strike listener

barch.description: Returns the architecture of your Beacon session (e.g., x86 or x64)

bargue_add.description: This function adds an option to Beacon's list of commands to spoof arguments for.

bargue_list.description: List the commands + fake arguments Beacon will spoof arguments for

bargue_remove.description: This function removes an option to Beacon's list of commands to spoof arguments for.

bblockdlls.description: Launch child processes with binary signature policy that blocks non-Microsoft DLLs from loading in the process space

bbrowser.description: Generate the beacon browser GUI component. Shows only Beacons.

bcd.description: Ask a Beacon to change it's current working directory

bcheckin.description: Ask a Beacon to checkin. This is basically a no-op for Beacon

bclear.description: This is the "oops" command. It clears the queued tasks for the specified beacon

bconnect.description: Ask Beacon (or SSH session) to connect to a Beacon peer over a TCP socket

bcovertvpn.description: Ask Beacon to deploy a Covert VPN client

bcp.description: Ask Beacon to copy a file or folder

bdata.description: Get metadata for a Beacon session

bdcsync.description: Use mimikatz's dcsync command to pull a user's password hash from a domain controller

bdllinject.description: Inject a Reflective DLL into a process

bdllload.description: Call LoadLibrary() in a remote process with the specified DLL.

bdllspawn.description: Spawn a Reflective DLL as a Beacon post-exploitation job

bdownload.description: Ask a Beacon to download a file

bdrives.description: Ask Beacon to list the drives on the compromised system

beacon_command_detail.description: Get the help information for a Beacon command

beacon_command_register.description: Register help information for a Beacon command

beacon_commands.description: Get a list of Beacon commands

beacon_data.description: Get metadata for a Beacon session

beacon_elevator_describe.description: Describe a Beacon command elevator exploit

beacon_elevator_register.description: Register a Beacon command elevator with Cobalt Strike. This adds an option to the runasadmin command

beacon_elevators.description: Get a list of command elevator exploits registered with Cobalt Strike

beacon_execute_job.description: Run a command and report its output to the user

beacon_exploit_register.description: Register a Beacon privilege escalation exploit with Cobalt Strike. This adds an option to the elevate command

beacon_exploits.description: Get a list of privilege escalation exploits registered with Cobalt Strike

beacon_host_imported_script.description: Locally host a previously imported PowerShell script within Beacon and return a short script that will download and invoke this script

beacon_host_script.description: Locally host a PowerShell script within Beacon and return a short script that will download and invoke this script. This function is a way to run large scripts when there are constraints on the length of your PowerShell one-liner

beacon_ids.description: Get the ID of all Beacons calling back to this Cobalt Strike team server

beacon_info.description: Get information from a Beacon session's metadata

beacon_link.description: This function links to an SMB or TCP listener. If the specified listener is not an SMB or TCP listener, this function does nothing

beacon_remote_exec_method_describe.description: Describe a Beacon remote execute method

beacon_remote_exec_method_register.description: Register a Beacon remote execute method with Cobalt Strike. This adds an option for use with the remote-exec command

beacon_remote_exec_methods.description: Get a list of remote execute methods registered with Cobalt Strike

beacon_remote_exploit_arch.description: Get the arch info for this Beacon lateral movement option

beacon_remote_exploit_describe.description: Describe a Beacon lateral movement option

beacon_remote_exploit_register.description: Register a Beacon lateral movement option with Cobalt Strike. This function extends the jump command

beacon_remote_exploits.description: Get a list of lateral movement options registered with Cobalt Strike

beacon_remove.description: Remove a Beacon from the display

beacon_stage_pipe.description: This function handles the staging process for a bind pipe stager. This is an optional stager for lateral movement. You can stage any x86 payload/listener through this stager. Use &stager_bind_pipe to generate this stager

beacon_stage_tcp.description: This function handles the staging process for a bind TCP stager. This is the preferred stager for localhost-only staging. You can stage any payload/listener through this stager. Use &stager_bind_tcp to generate this stager

beacons.description: Get information about all Beacons calling back to this Cobalt Strike team server

belevate.description: Ask Beacon to spawn an elevated session with a registered technique

belevate_command.description: Ask Beacon to run a command in a high-integrity context

berror.description: Publish an error message to the Beacon transcript

bexecute.description: Ask Beacon to execute a command [without a shell]. This provides no output to the user

bexecute_assembly.description: Spawns a local .NET executable assembly as a Beacon post-exploitation job

bgetprivs.description: Attempts to enable the specified privilege in your Beacon session

bgetsystem.description: Ask Beacon to attempt to get the SYSTEM token.

bgetuid.description: Ask Beacon to print the User ID of the current token

bhashdump.description: Ask Beacon to dump local account password hashes

binfo.description: Get information from a Beacon session's metadata

binject.description: Ask Beacon to inject a session into a specific process

binput.description: Report a command was run to the Beacon console and logs. Scripts that execute commands for the user (e.g., events, popup menus) should use this function to assure operator attribution of automated actions in Beacon's logs

bipconfig.description: Task a Beacon to list network interfaces

bjobkill.description: Ask Beacon to kill a running post-exploitation job

bjobs.description: Ask Beacon to list running post-exploitation jobs

bjump.description: Ask Beacon to spawn a session on a remote target

bkerberos_ccache_use.description: Ask beacon to inject a UNIX kerberos ccache file into the user's kerberos tray

bkerberos_ticket_purge.description: Ask beacon to purge tickets from the user's kerberos tray

bkerberos_ticket_use.description: Ask beacon to inject a mimikatz kirbi file into the user's kerberos tray

bkeylogger.description: Injects a keystroke logger into a process.

bkill.description: Ask Beacon to kill a process

blink.description: Ask Beacon to link to a host over a named pipe

blog.description: Post a message to WordPress.com (just kidding). Publishes an output message to the Beacon transcript

blog2.description: Publishes an output message to the Beacon transcript. This function has an alternate format from &blog

bloginuser.description: Ask Beacon to create a token from the specified credentials. This is the make_token command

blogonpasswords.description: Ask Beacon to dump in-memory credentials with mimikatz

bls.description: Task a Beacon to list files

bmimikatz.description: Ask Beacon to run a mimikatz command

bmkdir.description: Ask Beacon to make a directory

bmode.description: Change the data channel for a DNS Beacon

bmv.description: Ask Beacon to move a file or folder

bnet.description: Run a command from Beacon's net module

bnote.description: Assign a note to the specified Beacon

bpassthehash.description: Ask Beacon to create a token that passes the specified hash. This is the pth command in Beacon. It uses mimikatz

bpause.description: Ask Beacon to pause its execution. This is a one-off sleep.

bportscan.description: Ask Beacon to run its port scanner

bpowerpick.description: Spawn a process, inject Unmanaged PowerShell, and run the specified command

bpowershell.description: Ask Beacon to run a PowerShell cmdlet

bpowershell_import.description: Import a PowerShell script into a Beacon

bpowershell_import_clear.description: Clear the imported PowerShell script from a Beacon session

bppid.description: Set a parent process for Beacon's child processes

bps.description: Task a Beacon to list processes

bpsexec.description: Ask Beacon to spawn a payload on a remote host. This function generates an Artifact Kit executable, copies it to the target, and creates a service to run it. Clean up is included too

bpsexec_command.description: Ask Beacon to run a command on a remote host. This function creates a service on the remote host, starts it, and cleans it up

bpsinject.description: Inject Unmanaged PowerShell into a specific process and run the specified cmdlet

bpwd.description: Ask Beacon to print its current working directory

breg_query.description: Ask Beacon to query a key within the registry

breg_queryv.description: Ask Beacon to query a value within a registry key

bremote_exec.description: Ask Beacon to run a command on a remote target

brev2self.description: Ask Beacon to drop its current token. This calls the RevertToSelf() Win32 API

brm.description: Ask Beacon to remove a file or folder

brportfwd.description: Ask Beacon to setup a reverse port forward

brportfwd_stop.description: Ask Beacon to stop a reverse port forward

brun.description: Ask Beacon to run a command

brunas.description: Ask Beacon to run a command as another user

brunasadmin.description: Ask Beacon to run a command in a high-integrity context (bypasses UAC).

brunu.description: Ask Beacon to run a process under another process.

bscreenshot.description: Ask Beacon to take a screenshot

bsetenv.description: Ask Beacon to set an environment variable

bshell.description: Ask Beacon to run a command with cmd.exe

bshinject.description: Inject shellcode (from a local file) into a specific process

bshspawn.description: Spawn shellcode (from a local file) into another process. This function benefits from Beacon's configuration to spawn post-exploitation jobs (e.g., spawnto, ppid, etc.)

bsleep.description: Ask Beacon to change its beaconing interval and jitter factor

bsocks.description: Start a SOCKS proxy server associated with a beacon

bsocks_stop.description: Stop SOCKS proxy servers associated with the specified Beacon

bspawn.description: Ask Beacon to spawn a new session

bspawnas.description: Ask Beacon to spawn a session as another user

bspawnto.description: Change the default program Beacon spawns to inject capabilities into

bspawnu.description: Ask Beacon to spawn a session under another process.

bssh.description: Ask Beacon to spawn an SSH session

bssh_key.description: Ask Beacon to spawn an SSH session

bsteal_token.description: Ask Beacon to steal a token from a process

bsudo.description: Ask Beacon to run a command via sudo (SSH sessions only)

btask.description: Report a task acknowledgement for a Beacon. This task acknowledgement will also contribute to the narrative in Cobalt Strike's Activity Report and Sessions Report

btimestomp.description: Ask Beacon to change the file modified/accessed/created times to match another file

bunlink.description: Ask Beacon to delink a Beacon its connected to over a TCP socket or named pipe

bupload.description: Ask a Beacon to upload a file

bupload_raw.description: Ask a Beacon to upload a file

call.description: Issue a call to the team server

closeClient.description: Close the current Cobalt Strike team server connection

colorPanel.description: Generate a Java component to set accent colors within Cobalt Strike's data model

credential_add.description: Add a credential to the data model

credentials.description: Returns a list of application credentials in Cobalt Strike's data model

data_keys.description: List the query-able keys from Cobalt Strike's data model

dbutton_action.description: Adds an action button to a &dialog. When this button is pressed, the dialog closes and its callback is called. You may add multiple buttons to a dialog. Cobalt Strike will line these buttons up in a row and center them at the bottom of the dialog

dbutton_help.description: Adds a Help button to a &dialog. When this button is pressed, Cobalt Strike will open the user's browser to the specified URL

dialog.description: Create a dialog. Use &dialog_show to show it.

dispatch_event.description: Call a function in Java Swing's Event Dispatch Thread. Java's Swing Library is not thread safe. All changes to the user interface should happen from the Event Dispatch Thread

downloads.description: Returns a list of downloads in Cobalt Strike's data model

drow_beacon.description: Adds a beacon selection row to a &dialog

drow_exploits.description: Adds a privilege escalation exploit selection row to a &dialog

drow_file.description: Adds a file chooser row to a &dialog

drow_interface.description: Adds a VPN interface selection row to a &dialog

drow_krbtgt.description: Adds a krbtgt selection row to a &dialog

drow_listener.description: Adds a listener selection row to a &dialog. This row only shows listeners with stagers (e.g., windows/beacon_https/reverse_https).

drow_listener_stage.description: Adds a listener selection row to a &dialog. This row shows all Beacon and Foreign listener payloads.

drow_mailserver.description: Adds a mail server field to a &dialog.

drow_site.description: Adds a site/URL field to a &dialog.

drow_text.description: Adds a text field row to a &dialog

drow_text_big.description: Adds a multi-line text field to a &dialog

dstamp.description: Format a time into a date/time value. This value includes seconds.

elog.description: Publish a notification to the event log

encode.description: Obfuscate a position-independent blob of code with an encoder

format_size.description: Formats a number into a size (e.g., 1024 => 1kb)

getAggressorClient.description: Returns the aggressor.AggressorClient Java object. This can reach anything internal within the current Cobalt Strike client context

highlight.description: Insert an accent (color highlight) into Cobalt Strike's data model

host_delete.description: Delete a host from the targets model

host_update.description: Add or update a host in the targets model

hosts.description: Returns a list of IP addresses from Cobalt Strike's target model

insert_component.description: Add a javax.swing.JComponent object to the menu tree

insert_menu.description: Bring menus associated with a popup hook into the current menu tree.

iprange.description: Generate an array of IPv4 addresses based on a string description

keystrokes.description: Returns a list of keystrokes from Cobalt Strike's data model

licenseKey.description: Get the license key for this instance of Cobalt Strike

listeners.description: Return a list of listener names (with stagers only!) across all team servers this client is connected to

listeners_local.description: Return a list of listener names. This function limits itself to the current team server only. External C2 listener names are omitted

listeners_stageless.description: Return a list of listener names across all team servers this client is connected to. External C2 listeners are filtered (as they're not actionable via staging or exporting as a Reflective DLL).

localip.description: Get the IP address associated with the team server.

menubar.description: Add a top-level item to the menubar

mynick.description: Get the nickname associated with the current Cobalt Strike client

nextTab.description: Activate the tab that is to the right of the current tab

on.description: Register an event handler. This is an alternate to the on keyword

openApplicationManager.description: Open the application manager (system profiler results) tab

openBeaconConsole.description: Open the console to interact with a Beacon

openBrowserPivotSetup.description: open the browser pivot setup dialog

openBypassUACDialog.description: Open the dialog for the Bypass UAC feature.

openCloneSiteDialog.description: Open the dialog for the website clone tool

openCovertVPNSetup.description: open the Covert VPN setup dialog

openElevateDialog.description: Open the dialog to launch a privilege escalation exploit

openFileBrowser.description: Open the file browser for a Beacon

openGoldenTicketDialog.description: open a dialog to help generate a golden ticket

openInterfaceManager.description: Open the tab to manage Covert VPN interfaces

openJavaSignedAppletDialog.description: Open the Java Signed Applet dialog

openJavaSmartAppletDialog.description: Open the Java Smart Applet dialog

openJumpDialog.description: Open Cobalt Strike's lateral movement dialog

openMakeTokenDialog.description: open a dialog to help generate an access token

openOfficeMacro.description: Open the office macro export dialog

openOneLinerDialog.description: Open the dialog to generate a PowerShell one-liner for this specific Beacon session

openOrActivate.description: If a Beacon console exists, make it active. If a Beacon console does not exist, open it.

openPivotListenerSetup.description: open the pivot listener setup dialog

openPortScannerLocal.description: Open the port scanner dialog with options to target a Beacon's local network

openPowerShellWebDialog.description: Open the dialog to setup the PowerShell Web Delivery Attack

openProcessBrowser.description: Open a process browser for one or more Beacons

openSOCKSBrowser.description: Open the tab to list SOCKS proxy servers

openSOCKSSetup.description: open the SOCKS proxy server setup dialog

openScriptManager.description: Open the tab for the script manager.

openScriptedWebDialog.description: Open the dialog to setup a Scripted Web Delivery Attack

openSpawnAsDialog.description: Open dialog to spawn a payload as another user

openSpearPhishDialog.description: Open the dialog for the spear phishing tool.

openSystemProfilerDialog.description: Open the dialog to setup the system profiler.

openWindowsExecutableDialog.description: Open the dialog to generate a Windows executable

openWindowsExecutableStage.description: Open the dialog to generate a stageless Windows executable

payload.description: Exports a raw payload for a specific Cobalt Strike listener

pgraph.description: Generate the pivot graph GUI component

pivots.description: Returns a list of SOCKS pivots from Cobalt Strike's data model

popup_clear.description: Remove all popup menus associated with the current menu. This is a way to override Cobalt Strike's default popup menu definitions

powershell_command.description: Returns a one-liner to run a PowerShell expression (e.g., powershell.exe -nop -w hidden -encodedcommand MgAgACsAIAAyAA==)

powershell_compress.description: Compresses a PowerShell script and wraps it in a script to decompress and execute it.

pref_get.description: Grabs a string value from Cobalt Strike's preferences

pref_get_list.description: Grabs a list value from Cobalt Strike's preferences.

pref_set.description: Set a value in Cobalt Strike's preferences

pref_set_list.description: Stores a list value into Cobalt Strike's preferences.

previousTab.description: Activate the tab that is to the left of the current tab.

privmsg.description: Post a private message to a user in the event log

prompt_confirm.description: Show a dialog with Yes/No buttons. If the user presses yes, call the specified function.

prompt_text.description: Show a dialog that asks the user for text.

range.description: Generate an array of numbers based on a string description of ranges.

say.description: Post a public chat message to the event log.

sbrowser.description: Generate the session browser GUI component. Shows Beacon AND SSH sessions.

screenshots.description: Returns a list of screenshots from Cobalt Strike's data model

script_resource.description: Returns the full path to a resource that is stored relative to this script file.

separator.description: Insert a separator into the current menu tree.

services.description: Returns a list of services in Cobalt Strike's data model.

showVisualization.description: Switch Cobalt Strike visualization to a registered visualization.

show_error.description: Shows an error message to the user in a dialog box. Use this function to relay error information.

show_message.description: Shows a message to the user in a dialog box. Use this function to relay information.

site_host.description: Host content on Cobalt Strike's web server

site_kill.description: Remove a site from Cobalt Strike's web server

sites.description: Returns a list of sites tied to Cobalt Strike's web server.

ssh_command_detail.description: Get the help information for an SSH command.

ssh_command_register.description: Register help information for an SSH console command.

ssh_commands.description: Get a list of SSH commands.

stager.description: Returns the stager for a specific Cobalt Strike listener

stager_bind_pipe.description: Returns a bind_pipe stager for a specific Cobalt Strike listener. This stager is suitable for use in lateral movement actions that benefit from a small named pipe stager. Stage with &beacon_stage_pipe.

stager_bind_tcp.description: Returns a bind_tcp stager for a specific Cobalt Strike listener. This stager is suitable for use in localhost-only actions that require a small stager. Stage with &beacon_stage_tcp.

str_chunk.description: Chunk a string into multiple parts

str_decode.description: Convert a string of bytes to text with the specified encoding.

str_encode.description: Convert text to byte string with the specified character encoding.

str_xor.description: Walk a string and XOR it with the provided key.

sync_download.description: Sync a downloaded file (View -> Downloads) to a local path.

targets.description: Returns a list of host information in Cobalt Strike's data model.

tbrowser.description: Generate the target browser GUI component.

tokenToEmail.description: Covert a phishing token to an email address.

transform_vbs.description: Transform shellcode into a VBS expression that results in a string

tstamp.description: Format a time into a date/time value. This value does not include seconds.

url_open.description: Open a URL in the default browser.

users.description: Returns a list of users connected to this team server.

vpn_interface_info.description: Get information about a VPN interface.

vpn_interfaces.description: Return a list of VPN interface names

beacon_checkin.description: Fired when a Beacon checkin acknowledgement is posted to a Beacon's console

beacon_error.description: Fired when an error is posted to a Beacon's console.

beacon_indicator.description: Fired when an indicator of compromise notice is posted to a Beacon's console.

beacon_initial.description: Fired when a Beacon calls home for the first time.

beacon_initial_empty.description: Fired when a DNS Beacon calls home for the first time. At this point, no metadata has been exchanged.

beacon_input.description: Fired when an input message is posted to a Beacon's console.

beacon_mode.description: Fired when a mode change acknowledgement is posted to a Beacon's console.

beacon_output.description: Fired when output is posted to a Beacon's console.

beacon_output_alt.description: Fired when (alternate) output is posted to a Beacon's console. What makes for alternate output? It's just different presentation from normal output.

beacon_output_jobs.description: Fired when jobs output is sent to a Beacon's console.

beacon_output_ls.description: Fired when ls output is sent to a Beacon's console.

beacon_output_ps.description: Fired when ps output is sent to a Beacon's console.

beacon_tasked.description: Fired when a task acknowledgement is posted to a Beacon's console.

beacons.description: Fired when the team server sends over fresh information on all of our Beacons. This occurs about once each second.

disconnect.description: Fired when this Cobalt Strike becomes disconnected from the team server.

event_action.description: Fired when a user performs an action in the event log. This is similar to an action on IRC (the /me command)

event_beacon_initial.description: Fired when an initial beacon message is posted to the event log.

event_join.description: Fired when a user connects to the team server

event_newsite.description: Fired when a new site message is posted to the event log.

event_notify.description: Fired when a message from the team server is posted to the event log.

event_nouser.description: Fired when the current Cobalt Strike client tries to interact with a user who is not connected to the team server.

event_private.description: Fired when a private message is posted to the event log.

event_public.description: Fired when a public message is posted to the event log.

event_quit.description: Fired when someone disconnects from the team server.

keylogger_hit.description: Fired when there are new results reported to the web server via the cloned site keystroke logger.

profiler_hit.description: Fired when there are new results reported to the System Profiler.

ready.description: Fired when this Cobalt Strike client is connected to the team server and ready to act.

sendmail_done.description: Fired when a phishing campaign completes

sendmail_post.description: Fired after a phish is sent to an email address.

sendmail_pre.description: Fired before a phish is sent to an email address.

sendmail_start.description: Fired when a new phishing campaign kicks off.

ssh_checkin.description: Fired when an SSH client checkin acknowledgement is posted to an SSH console.

ssh_error.description: Fired when an error is posted to an SSH console.

ssh_initial.description: Fired when an SSH session is seen for the first time.

ssh_input.description: Fired when an input message is posted to an SSH console.

ssh_output.description: Fired when output is posted to an SSH console.

ssh_output_alt.description: Fired when (alternate) output is posted to an SSH console. What makes for alternate output? It's just different presentation from normal output.

ssh_tasked.description: Fired when a task acknowledgement is posted to an SSH console.

web_hit.description: Fired when there's a new hit on Cobalt Strike's web server.

agApplications.description: Pull information from the applications model.

agC2info.description: Pull information from the c2info model.

agCredentials.description: Pull information from the credentials model

agServices.description: Pull information from the services model

agSessions.description: Pull information from the sessions model

agTargets.description: Pull information from the targets model.

agTokens.description: Pull information from the phishing tokens model.

attack_describe.description: Maps a MITRE ATT&CK tactic ID to its longer description.

attack_detect.description: Maps a MITRE ATT&CK tactic ID to its detection strategy

attack_mitigate.description: Maps a MITRE ATT&CK tactic ID to its mitigation strategy

attack_name.description: Maps a MITRE ATT&CK tactic ID to its short name.

attack_tactics.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK tactics known to Cobalt Strike.

attack_url.description: Maps a MITRE ATT&CK tactic ID to the URL where you can learn more.

describe.description: Set a description for a report.

kvtable.description: Prints a table with key/value pairs.

landscape.description: Changes the orientation of this document to landscape.

layout.description: Prints a table with no borders and no column headers.

nobreak.description: Group report elements together without a line break.

output.description: Print elements against a grey backdrop. Line-breaks are preserved.

p_formatted.description: Prints a paragraph of text with some format preservation.

ts.description: Prints a time/date stamp in italics.

pe_insert_rich_header.description: Insert rich header data into Beacon DLL Content. If there is existing rich header information, it will be replaced.

pe_mask.description: Mask data in the Beacon DLL Content based on position and length.

pe_mask_section.description: Mask data in the Beacon DLL Content based on position and length.

pe_mask_string.description: Mask a string in the Beacon DLL Content based on position.

pe_patch_code.description: Patch code in the Beacon DLL Content based on find/replace in .text section.

pe_remove_rich_header.description: Remove the rich header from Beacon DLL Content.

pe_set_compile_time_with_long.description: Set the compile time in the Beacon DLL Content.

pe_set_compile_time_with_string.description: Set the compile time in the Beacon DLL Content.

pe_set_export_name.description: Set the export name in the Beacon DLL Content.

pe_set_long.description: Places a long value at a specified location.

pe_set_short.description: Places a short value at a specified location.

pe_set_string.description: Places a string value at a specified location.

pe_set_stringz.description: Places a string value at a specified location and adds a zero terminator.

pe_set_value_at.description: Sets a long value based on the location resolved by a name from the PE Map (see pedump).

pe_stomp.description: Set a string to null characters. Start at a specified location and sets all characters to null until a null string terminator is reached.

pe_update_checksum.description: Update the checksum in the Beacon DLL Content.

pedump.description: Parse an executable Beacon into a map of the PE Header information. The parsed information can be used for research or programmatically to make changes to the Beacon.
